metadata.title: CVE-2024-1554 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: The `fetch()` API and navigation incorrectly shared the same cache, as thecache key did not include the optional headers `fetch()` may contain. Underthe correct circumstances, an attacker may have been able to poison thelocal browser cache by priming it with a `fetch()` response controlled bythe additional headers. Upon navigation to the same URL, the user would seethe cached response instead of the expected response. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 123.

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
